alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, Knox, northeastern McCreary, northern Whitley and southwestern Clay Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1159 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Youngs Creek, or 9 miles northwest of Williamsburg, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Faber, Rockholds and Wofford around 1205 PM EDT. Woodbine, Moore Hill, Barton, North Corbin, Dorthae and Perkins around 1210 PM EDT. Rossland, Bertha Station, Arkle, Wilton, Gray, Indian Creek, Dishman Springs, Lynn Camp, McHargue and Permon around 1215 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Barbourville, Bentley Station, Garrich, Lowell, Emmanuel, Baileys Switch, Heidrick, Knoxfork, Swanpond, Tuttle, Girdler, Green Road, Cannon, Hinkle, Jarvis, Fount, Cranes Nest, Fletcher, Bimble, Yeager, Barnyard, Haven, Woollum, Dewitt, Walker, Cottongin and Jonsee. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 14 and 30. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 26. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
